entry.title: The Water Resources (Environmental Impact Assessment) (England and Wales) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations complete the implementation, in relation to water management projects for agriculture in England and Wales, of Council Directive 85/337/EEC on the assessment of the effects of certain public and private projects on the environment (O.J. No. L175, 5.7.1975, p.40), as amended by Council Directive 97/11/EC (O.J. No. L73, 14.3.1997, p.5).

entry.title: The Copyright (Certification of Licensing Scheme for Educational Recording of Broadcasts) (Open University) Order 2003
entry.summary: Under section 35 of the Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 (1988 c. 48) (“the Act”) recordings of broadcasts and cable programmes may be made by or on behalf of educational establishments for the educational purposes of that establishment without thereby infringing copyright. The section does not apply, however, if or to the extent that there is a licensing scheme certified for the purposes of that section under section 143 of the Act providing for the grant of licences.

entry.title: The National Health Service Superannuation Scheme (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the National Health Service Superannuation Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 1995 (“the 1995 Regulations”) which provide for the superannuation of persons engaged in the National Health Service in Scotland. Certain provisions have retrospective effect as authorised by section 12 of the Superannuation Act 1972: regulations 3(b) and (c) and 14 to 21 shall have effect from 1st April 2001, regulations 5(b) and (c), 7 to 10, 11(2) and (3), and 12 shall have effect from 1st April 2002 and regulations 5(a), 6 and 11(1) shall have effect from 25th April 2000. All other amendments shall have effect from the date of coming into force of these Regulations.

entry.title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (Financial Threshold for Civil Recovery) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order specifies the financial threshold for the purposes of section 287 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002. Under section 287, the enforcement authority (ie the Director or the Scottish Ministers) cannot start proceedings for a recovery order under Part 5 unless the authority reasonably believes that the value of the property which is to be the subject of the recovery order is not less than the specified amount.

entry.title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (Crown Servants) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: Part 7 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 creates money laundering offences and makes ancillary provision to those offences. Section 342 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 creates offences of prejudicing investigations. These Regulations apply Part 7 and section 342 to the Director of Savings and his staff.

entry.title: The Civil Legal Aid (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Civil Legal Aid (Scotland) Regulations 2002 (“the 2002 Regulations”) so that, for the purposes of calculating financial eligibility for civil legal aid, the resources of a person’s partner of the same sex are taken into account (regulation 4).

entry.title: The Education (School Admissions Code of Practice and School Admission Appeals Code of Practice) (Appointed Day) (England) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order appoints 31st January 2003 as the day on which the School Admissions Code of Practice and the School Admission Appeals Code of Practice, issued pursuant to section 85(5) of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 by the Secretary of State for Education and Skills, come into force. The new Codes apply only in relation to England.

entry.title: The Police Act 1997 (Criminal Records)(Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the form prescribed by the Police Act 1997 (Criminal Records) Regulations 2002 (S.I. 2002/233) for applications for criminal record certificates and enhanced criminal record certificates. Sections E and F of the application form, which require the applicant to supply additional information to assist in identity checking and details of referees respectively, are omitted. The Criminal Records Bureau no longer requires this information to be supplied on the application form to enable an application to be processed.

entry.title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (Failure to Disclose Money Laundering: Specified Training) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order specifies training for the purposes of section 330 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002. If a person has not been provided by his employer with the specified training, he may have a defence to the offence in section 330 of failure to disclose money laundering by a person in the regulated sector. The defence only applies where the employee does not actually know or suspect that another person is engaged in money laundering, but would still commit the offence by virtue of having reasonable grounds for knowing or suspecting that another person is engaged in money laundering.

title.div: The Local Authorities (Executive Arrangements) (Discharge of Functions) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Awdurdodau Lleol (Trefniadau Gweithrediaeth) (Cyflawni Swyddogaethau) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: The Local Authorities (Executive Arrangements) (Discharge of Functions) (Wales) Regulations 2002, made under Part II of the Local Government Act 2000, enabled a local authority in Wales operating executive arrangements to make arrangements for the discharge of its executive functions by area committees, the executive of another local authority or jointly with one or more other local authorities by way of joint committee.

Galluogodd Rheoliadau Awdurdodau Lleol (Trefniadau Gweithrediaeth) (Cyflawni Swyddogaethau) (Cymru) 2002, a wnaed o dan Ran II o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 2000, awdurdod lleol yng Nghymru a weithredai drefniadau gweithrediaeth i wneud trefniadau fel y cyflawnir ei swyddogaethau gweithrediaeth gan bwyllgorau ardal, gweithrediaeth awdurdod lleol arall neu ar y cyd ag un neu fwy o awdurdodau lleol drwy gyfrwng cyd-bwyllgor.

entry.title: The Regulation of Investigatory Powers (Prescription of Offices, Ranks and Positions) (Scotland) Amendment (No. 2) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order revokes and restates the provisions in the Regulation of Investigatory Powers (Prescription of Offices, Ranks and Positions) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2003 (S.S.I. 2003/20) (“the First Amendment Order”).

entry.title: The Animal By-Products (Identification) Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, amend the Animal By Products (Identification) Regulations 1995 (“the 1995 Regulations”). The 1995 Regulations currently make provision for the sterilisation or staining of animal by products and for the control of movement of such by-products.

title.div: The Local Authorities Executive Arrangements (Functions and Responsibilities) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Trefniadau Gweithrediaeth Awdurdodau Lleol (Swyddogaethau a Chyfrifoldebau) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: Part II of the Local Government Act 2000 provides for the discharge of a local authority’s functions by an authority’s executive unless those functions are specified as functions not to be the responsibility of the authority’s executive.

Mae Rhan II o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 2000 yn darparu i swyddogaethau awdurdod lleol gael eu cyflawni gan weithrediaeth i'r awdurdod onid yw'r swyddogaethau hynny wedi'u pennu yn swyddogaethau nad ydynt yn gyfrifoldeb i weithrediaeth yr awdurdod.

entry.title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (References to Financial Investigators) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order provides that references to accredited financial investigators in the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (“the Act”) are to be read as references to accredited financial investigators within the description specified in this Order. Accredited financial investigators may apply for restraint orders under Parts 2 and 4 of the Act and may apply for orders and warrants in relation to confiscation investigations and money laundering investigations under Part 8 of the Act.

title.div: The Sheep Annual Premium (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Premiwm Blynyddol Defaid (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: These Regulations, which come into force on 3rd February 2003, amend the Sheep Annual Premium Regulations 1992 (S.I. 1992/2677, as already amended by S.I. 1994/2741, 1995/2779, 1996/49, 1997/2500 and 2000/2573) (“the principal Regulations”).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n dod i rym ar 3 Chwefror 2003, yn diwygio Rheoliadau Premiwm Blynyddol Defaid 1992 (O.S. 1992/2677, fel y'u diwygiwyd eisoes gan O.S. 1994/2741, 1995/2779, 1996/49, 1997/2500 a 2000/2573) (“y prif Reoliadau”).

title.div: The Local Health Boards (Establishment) (Wales) Order 2003 / Gorchymyn Byrddau Iechyd Lleol (Sefydlu) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: The strategy document Improving Health in Wales, published by the National Assembly for Wales in February 2001, signalled the intention to abolish the existing five Health Authorities in Wales on 1st April 2003 and to create Local Health Boards to which the National Assembly may delegate functions of Health Authorities transferred to it pursuant to section 27 of the Government of Wales Act 1998 (1998 c. 38), and other functions of the National Assembly relating to the health service.

Roedd y ddogfen strategaeth Gwella Iechyd yng Nghymru, a gyhoeddwyd gan Gynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru fis Chwefror 2001, yn dynodi'r bwriad i ddiddymu'r pum Awdurdod Iechyd sydd eisoes yn bodoli yng Nghymru ar 1 Ebrill 2003 a chreu Byrddau Iechyd Lleol y gall y Cynulliad Cenedlaethol ddirprwyo iddynt swyddogaethau Awdurdodau Iechyd a drosglwyddwyd iddo yn unol ag adran 27 o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Cymru 1998 (1998 p.38), a swyddogaethau eraill y Cynulliad Cenedlaethol sy'n ymwneud â'r gwasanaeth iechyd.

title.div: The Local Authorities (Alternative Arrangements) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Awdurdodau Lleol (Trefniadau Amgen) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: Part II of the Local Government Act 2000 provides for the National Assembly for Wales to specify which local authorities may operate “alternative arrangements” i.e. arrangements for the discharge of an authority’s functions which do not involve the creation and operation of an executive in accordance with section 31(1)(b) and section 32(1).

Mae Rhan II o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 2000 yn darparu bod Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru yn pennu pa awdurdodau lleol a gaiff weithredu “trefniadau amgen” h.y. trefniadau ar gyfer cyflawni swyddogaethau awdurdod nad ydynt yn golygu creu a gweithredu gweithrediaeth yn unol ag adran 31(1)(b) ac adran 32(1).

title.div: The Care Standards Act 2000 (Commencement No. 10) and Transitional Provisions (Wales) Order 2003 / Gorchymyn Deddf Safonau Gofal 2000 (Cychwyn Rhif 10) a Darpariaethau Trosiannol (Cymru) 2003

div.p: This Order brings into force a number of provisions of the Care Standards Act 2000 relating to the regulation of Residential Family Centres, Voluntary Adoption Agencies, Fostering Agencies and Local Authority Adoption Services. This will have the effect of bringing these establishments and agencies within the regulatory framework of the Care Standards Act 2000, to be enforced in Wales by the National Assembly for Wales.

Mae'r Gochymyn hwn yn dod â nifer o ddarpariaethau Deddf Safonau Gofal 2000 i rym mewn perthynas â rheoleiddio Canolfannau Preswyl i Deulueodd, Asiantaethau Mabwysiadu Gwirfoddol, Asiantaethau Maethu a Gwasanaethau Mabwysiadau Awdurdodau Lleol. Effaith y Gorchymyn hwn fydd dod â'r sefydliadau a'r asiantaethau hyn o fewn fframwaith rheoleiddio Deddf Safonau Gofal 2000, a gaiff ei orfodi yng Nghymru gan Gynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru.

title.div: The Local Health Boards (Constitution, Membership and Procedures) (Wales) Regulations 2003 / Rheoliadau Byrddau Iechyd Lleol (Cyfansoddiad, Aelodaeth a Gweithdrefnau) (Cymru) 2003

div.p: The strategy document “Improving Health in Wales”, published by the National Assembly for Wales in February 2001, signalled the intention to abolish the existing five Health Authorities in Wales on 31st March 2003 and to create Local Health Boards (“LHBs”) to which the National Assembly may delegate the functions of Health Authorities and other functions of the National Assembly relating to the health service.

Yr oedd y ddogfen strategaeth “Gwella Iechyd yng Nghymru”, a gyhoeddwyd gan Gynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru fis Chwefror 2001, yn dynodi'r bwriad i ddiddymu'r pum Awdurdod Iechyd presennol yng Nghymru ar 1 Ebrill 2003 a chreu Byrddau Iechyd Lleol y gall y Cynulliad Cenedlaethol ddirprwyo swyddogaethau'r Awdurdodau Iechyd a swyddogaethau eraill y Cynulliad Cenedlaethol sy'n ymwneud â'r gwasanaeth iechyd iddynt.

entry.title: The Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (Application of Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984 and Police and Criminal Evidence (Northern Ireland) Order 1989) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order applies, with specified modifications, certain provisions of the Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984 and the Police and Criminal Evidence (Northern Ireland) Order 1989 to search and seizure warrants sought under section 352 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 for the purposes of a confiscation investigation or a money laundering investigation and powers of seizure under them.
